solr_doc_hash.mms_name: Italian Diary. Holograph, 1859.
solr_doc_hash.collection_name: Nathaniel Hawthorne collection of papers, 1694-1931 bulk (1817-1864).
title: Italian Diary. Holograph, 1859.
title_sort: Italian Diary. Holograph, 1859.
name: Hawthorne, Sophia Peabody, 1809-1871
Hawthorne, Una, 1844-1877
Hawthorne, Julian, 1846-1934
Lathrop, Rose Hawthorne, 1851-1926
physicalDescription_note: 16mo pocket diary, short entries for every day of 1859.
note: See The French and Italian Notebooks, Centenary Edition vol. XIV (Ohio State University Press, Columbus, Ohio, 1980), 633-708.
See the Italian Diary, 1859. The Hawthorne Diary of 1859, typed transcription by William L. Reenan, 1931. Privately for W. T. H. Howe, also in NYPL digital collections.
W. T. H. Howe acquired the diary at auction in 1924 from Stephen H. Wakeman, who in turn had purchased it from Dodd & Livingston (Robert H. Dodd) in 1912.

title_sort: Italian Diary, 1859. The Hawthorne Diary of 1859, typed transcription by William L. Reenan, 1931.
name: Reenan, William L., 1884-1949
Howe, William T. H., 1874 â 1939
physicalDescription_note: Typed transcription, in spring binder (28 x 20.5 cm), with introduction and notes identifying people mentioned in the diary.
note: William Reenan transcribed Hawthorne's diary of 1859 for W. T. H. Howe of the American Book Company. Between 1929-1932, Reenan tried to identify the persons and places noted the diary, corresponding with survivors, and the results of this research are contained in the notes. Reenan never published the diary.  The Berg Collection holds two copies of Reenan's typescript and the more complete one has been digitized with the Hawthorne papers. The correspondence is also now held at the Berg: William L. Reenan Correspondence.
See The French and Italian Notebooks, Centenary Edition XIV (Ohio State University Press, Columbus, Ohio, 1980), 633-708.
identifier_local_call: Hawthorne, Nathaniel -  Diary -  1859.  Typescript
identifier_idx_local_call: Hawthorne, Nathaniel -  Diary -  1859.  Typescript

solr_doc_hash.mms_name: Dolliver Romance. MS in Sophia Hawthorne's hand of the story, "Another Fragment of the Dolliver Romance."
solr_doc_hash.collection_name: Nathaniel Hawthorne collection of papers, 1694-1931 bulk (1817-1864).
title: The  Dolliver Romance. MS in Sophia Hawthorne's hand of the story, "Another Fragment of the Dolliver Romance."
title_sort: Dolliver Romance. MS in Sophia Hawthorne's hand of the story, "Another Fragment of the Dolliver Romance."
name: Hawthorne, Sophia Peabody, 1809-1871
physicalDescription_note: [17 written sides, with one verso note].
note: "The first chapter [A Scene from the Dolliver Romance] was published in the 'Atlantic' as an isolated portion, soon after his death; and subsequently the second chapter, which he had been unable to revise, appeared in the same periodical [Another Scene from the Dolliver Romance]. Between this and the third fragment there is a gap, for bridging which no material was found among his papers; but, after hesitating for several years, Mrs. Hawthorne copied and placed in the publishersâ hands that final portion, which, with the two parts previously printed, constitutes the whole of what Hawthorne had put into tangible form." George Parsons Lathrop, Introductory Note to "The Dolliver Romance," in The Complete Works of Nathaniel Hawthorne (13 vols.), vol. 11, p. 12.
First published in The Dolliver Romance and Other Pieces, Boston: James R. Osgood & co., 1876.
See Centenary Edition, vol. XIII, The Elixir of Life Manuscripts.
identifier_local_call: m.b. Hawthorne, Nathaniel. Holographs
identifier_idx_local_call: m.b. Hawthorne, Nathaniel. Holographs

solr_doc_hash.mms_name: Hathorne [Hawthorne], William, letter to the Right Honorable [William Morrice, Secretary of State]. Oct. 26, 1666. Copy in unknown hand, note in NH's hand.
solr_doc_hash.collection_name: Nathaniel Hawthorne collection of papers, 1694-1931 bulk (1817-1864).
title: Hathorne [Hawthorne], William, letter to the Right Honorable [William Morrice, Secretary of State]. Oct. 26, 1666. Copy in unknown hand, note in NH's hand.
title_sort: Hathorne [Hawthorne], William, letter to the Right Honorable [William Morrice, Secretary of State]. Oct. 26, 1666. Copy in unknown hand, note in NH's hand.
name: Hathorne, William, 1607-1681
Morrice, William, 1602-1676
Nadhorth, Samuel
physicalDescription_note:
[10 written pages]. 
 1 page addressed to "Nathaniel Hawthorne Esq. | Consul of the United States of America | Liverpool." with note by NH: 
 "Copy of a letter supposed to have been written by Major William Hawthorne, of Massachusetts, defending that Colony against the accusations of the Commissioners of Charles II, and excusing the General Court for declining to send over Governor Bellingham and himself, in compliance with the King's orders. (From the State Paper Office, London, Rec.d July 24th 1856.)
note: Nathaniel Hawthorne spells his ancestor's name anachronistically as "Hawthorne," the spelling NH himself had adopted, rather than "Hathorne," the original spelling.
identifier_local_call: m.b. (Hawthorne, Nathaniel)
identifier_idx_local_call: m.b. (Hawthorne, Nathaniel)

solr_doc_hash.mms_name: Italian Diary, 1859. Typed transcript of the Hawthorne Diary of 1859. Edited by William L. Reenan, 1931.
solr_doc_hash.collection_name: Nathaniel Hawthorne collection of papers, 1694-1931 bulk (1817-1864).
title: Italian Diary, 1859. Typed transcription of the Hawthorne Diary of 1859. Edited by William L. Reenan, 1931. (longer version)
title_sort: Italian Diary, 1859. Typed transcription of the Hawthorne Diary of 1859. Edited by William L. Reenan, 1931. (longer version)
name: Reenan, William L., 1884-1949
Howe, William T. H., 1874 â 1939
physicalDescription_note: Typed transcription, loose leaf (21.5 x 14 cm), with introduction and notes identifying people mentioned in the diary.
note:
William Reenan transcribed Hawthorne's diary of 1859 for W. T. H. Howe of the American Book Company. Between 1929-1932, Reenan tried to identify the persons and places noted the diary, corresponding with survivors, and the results of this research are contained in the notes. Reenan never published the diary.  The Berg Collection holds two copies of Reenan's typescript and the more complete one has been digitized with the Hawthorne papers. 
The correspondence is held at the Berg: William L. Reenan Correspondence.
Reenan also transcribed 56 of Una Hawthorne's letters to her grandmother and grandfather, and her aunts, Elizabeth Palmer Peabody and Mary Mann, also in the Berg Collection and also digitized (see: Hawthorne, Una, 56 ALS to aunts, EPP and MTPM, grandmother and grandfather. Jul. 19, 1852 - Jun 5, 1861. Typed transcriptions.).
See The French and Italian Notebooks, Centenary Edition XIV (Ohio State University Press, Columbus, Ohio, 1980), 633-708.
identifier_local_call: (env) The Hawthorne diary of 1859. Edited by William L. Reenan.
identifier_idx_local_call: (env) The Hawthorne diary of 1859. Edited by William L. Reenan.

Hawthorne, Una, 1844-1877
physicalDescription_note:
[51 written pages], numbered 1-21, 23, 25-39, 42, 47, 51,  57-66. Writing paper, sometimes cut from several leaves, mounted on larger leaves, with occasional comment and insertions.
 Head of first page: The journal about the daily frolics of his children, written by Hawthorne, from which extracts were printed in the "Life", is here given more fully:--
 Verso of final page: "Copy" sent to the printers for "Memories of Hawthorne.["]  Some original MS (letters) by Mr. Hawthorne.
note: Rose Hawthorne Lathrop, Memories of Hawthorne (1897). Not published in full.

solr_doc_hash.mms_name: Wilcox, J. A. J., line engraving on steel, 1883.
solr_doc_hash.collection_name: Nathaniel Hawthorne collection of papers, 1694-1931 bulk (1817-1864).
title: Wilcox, J. A. J., line engraving on steel, 1883.
title_sort: Wilcox, J. A. J., line engraving on steel, 1883.
name: Wilcox, John Angel James, b. 1835
physicalDescription_note:
Portrait used in volume V of the 1883 Standard Library edition of The Works of Nathaniel Hawthorne in fifteen volumes. According to Rita Gollin, in Portraits of Nathaniel Hawthorne, Wilcox, who worked as a photographer in Boston from 1860 on, "was particularly admired for his line engraved portraits" (84). 
 Enclosed with letter to President Buchanan.

Howe</note><identifier ID="identifier_0" type="local_other" displayLabel="accession number">132360B</identifier><location ID="location_0"><physicalLocation authority="marcorg" type="repository">nn</physicalLocation><physicalLocation type="division">BRG</physicalLocation><shelfLocator>NH ALS to Pres't James Buchanan  Jan 31 1857</shelfLocator></location></mods>

title: Holograph quotation from the Italian Journals. Signed, dated 30 May, 1860.
title_sort: Holograph quotation from the Italian Journals. Signed, dated 30 May, 1860.
physicalDescription_note:
Seven lines quoted from Italian Journals, signed and dated for an album. Typed note and transcription, 1 leaf.
 On verso of leaf: signature of Irish politician Issac Butt, dated June 25, 1842; verse quotation and signature of Irish surgeon William R. Wilde, Dublin, July 1841.

title_sort: Hawthorne, Una, AL to NH. Apr. 3, [n.y.].
name: Hawthorne, Una, 1844-1877
physicalDescription_note: [1 written side]
note: The letter is dated from Wayside, the house that the Hawthornes moved into in June 1852 and returned to in 1860, arriving in the US from Europe in June. Una's handwriting in the early 1850s was more immature than appears in this letter.

solr_doc_hash.mms_name: Tappan, [Caroline], letter to. Sep. 5, [1851]. Copy in the hand of SAPH.
solr_doc_hash.collection_name: Nathaniel Hawthorne collection of papers, 1694-1931 bulk (1817-1864).
title: Tappan, [Caroline], letter to. Sep. 5, [1851]. Copy in the hand of SAPH.
title_sort: Tappan, [Caroline], letter to. Sep. 5, [1851]. Copy in the hand of SAPH.
name: Tappan, Caroline Sturgis, 1819-1888
physicalDescription_note:
[6 written pages] with envelope (George Parsons Lathrop) inscribed "Copy of Amusing letter from N. H. To Mrs Tappan, in Lenox, 1851 (Sept 5th)." 
 Typed note, 1 slip.
note:
Centenary Edition, XVI, The Letters 1843-1853, p.481, #508.
 The CE text is taken from version printed in magazine The Century XLVII (November, 1894), 93-94, and editors state that the source for this was "probably a transcript of [N.H.'s] draft by SH included in a letter to Elizabeth P. Peabody, now unknown". This is appears to be the conjectured transcript.
 Another version of the letter was published in Rose Hawthorne Lathrop's Memories of Hawthorne (1897), 163-67. The CE rejects most variant readings from Memories, but all of these reflect the letter as copied in this transcript.
identifier_local_call: m.b. Hawthorne, Nathaniel. ALS
identifier_idx_local_call: m.b. Hawthorne, Nathaniel. ALS

solr_doc_hash.mms_name: Alcott, Louisa May. "The Hawthorne." Holograph poem, signed "neighbor Lu," undated.
solr_doc_hash.collection_name: Nathaniel Hawthorne collection of papers, 1694-1931 bulk (1817-1864).
title: Alcott, Louisa May. "The Hawthorne." Holograph poem, signed "neighbor Lu," undated.
title_sort: Alcott, Louisa May. "The Hawthorne." Holograph poem, signed "neighbor Lu," undated.
name: Alcott, Louisa May, 1832-1888
physicalDescription_note:
[3 written pages];

accompanied by typed card "Poem by / Louisa May Alcott / "The Hawthorne".
note:
"The spinster who has just been blest / Finds solemn thirty much improved / By proofs that such a crabbed soul / Is still remembered & beloved. / Kind wishes 'ancient Lu' has stored..." 
 Louisa May Alcott was born Nov. 29, 1832, so implies a date following November 29, 1862.
 See Rita K. Gollin, "Louisa May Alcott's 'Hawthorne'", The Concord Saunterer, Fall 1980 (15:3), p. 16-19.
identifier_local_call: The Hawthorne -- Autograph Poem -- Louisa M. Alcott
identifier_idx_local_call: The Hawthorne -- Autograph Poem -- Louisa M. Alcott

solr_doc_hash.mms_name: Turnbull, Geo[rge] & Co., ALS to NH. Aug. 27, 1863.
solr_doc_hash.collection_name: Nathaniel Hawthorne collection of papers, 1694-1931 bulk (1817-1864).
title: Turnbull, Geo[rge] & Co., ALS to NH. Aug. 27, 1863.
title_sort: Turnbull, Geo[rge] & Co., ALS to NH. Aug. 27, 1863.
name: Turnbull, George & Co.
physicalDescription_note: [1 written sides], mounted in bound book; written over and blank verso used by NH for fragment of Dolliver Romance (q.v.).
note:
"We are sorry that we have no more of the Marseille[s?] left such as you enclose."
 The Boston Directory 1862 lists the business as "Dry Goods" and gives the proprietors as "Wm. W. Churchill and E. M. Watson." It possibly refers to Marseille soap.

identifier_idx_local_call: Hawthorne   Dolliver Romance +
